pending.content: SKIDATA is currently conducting an exciting proof of concept for the AI ​​Photo Check in Kitzbühel, Zermatt and Sierra Nevada – and the AI ​​is already learning rapidly. The challenge Today, lift operators often have to visually compare more than 10,000 photos to detect potential ticket fraud. This is strenuous, tiring and prone to errors – especially when guests wear helmets and ski goggles, which makes classic facial recognition unusable. Skidata approach: AI Photo Check SKIDATA has developed its own AI for image similarity checks, which marks suspicious passes within fractions of a second. Staff only need to check tickets whose probability of fraud exceeds a defined threshold – which in practice means around 10-15 checks per day instead of thousands. Important: SKIDATA AI Photo Check is not a biometric solution and does not offer facial recognition. pending.title: Riders Safety Workshop With Freeride World Tour Athletes
pending.description: Before any competitions, the world's top freeride athletes, both skiers and snowboarders, are required to partake in a safety workshop.
pending.content: The first weather window of the Freeride World Tour season kicks off next week with the 2026 Baqueira Beret Pro by Movistar , set to go down at some point between January 15th-20th. But before the competition can happen, the world’s top freeride athletes, both skiers and snowboarders, are required to partake in a safety workshop. The Riders Safety Workshop includes three major clinics. The first focuses on search strategy, working on the basics of beacon use in the event of an avalanche. The second clinic discusses technology and interference, showing how different technology like cameras and phones can disrupt a beacon’s function. Finally, the third clinic focuses on real-life scenario training, prepping the athletes for the worst case scenarios. Of course the hope is that none of these scenarios occur in competition, but it’s truly great to see how much focus the FIS Freeride World Tour puts on these necessary skills just in case something does occur. Winter 2025-26 is on course to break records again. “It was a rock solid good year. For America we had an amazing record,” said Martin Nydegger, Director of Switzerland Tourism, commenting on figures that saw US overnight stays reach 1.7m during the winter season alone. The surge appears driven by a stark price disparity that makes transatlantic travel look increasingly sensible. pending.content: There’s still nearly 2 months until the end of winter and the start of spring, but one Pennsylvania ski resort is already stating their intentions for what they hope will be their longest season in their history. A Mountain Update from Camelback Resort VP & General Manager Jason Bays discussed their plans for the spring. Right now, Camelback is planning to keep skiing and snowboarding going daily until April 12th, but it hopefully won’t end there. With 20-30 foot piles of stockpiled snow, Camelback hopes to keep skiing going on weekends into May, marking the longest ski season in Pennsylvania and potentially one of the longest ski seasons in the East. Camelback, located in the Poconos, has 11 lifts for skiing and snowboarding and 2 lifts for tubing. There are 39 named trails spread across the mountain. pending.content: A new drone was deployed by the Santa Fe Fire Department to assist a lost hiker on Tuesday, February 3rd. The lost 62-year-old hiker was near the top of Aspen Vista Road close to the summit of Ski Santa Fe when she contacted the Regional Emergency Communication Center for assistance. The Santa Fe Fire Department and Ski Santa Fe Employees were dispatched to assist. According to KOAT7 , the drone was used to locate the woman on the trail. The woman was wearing appropriate gear but did not have skis or snowshoes. She was with her dog when she got lost. She managed to get off trail and because of the deep snow was unable to find her way back to Aspen Vista Road. The Communication Center received the call for help at 3:30pm and the operation had concluded by 6pm, with the Santa Fe Fire Department, the Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office, and Ski Santa Fe working together to retrieve the hiker from just outside Ski Santa Fe’s boundaries. Zantonini, originally from Brindisi, was working a 12-hour overnight shift for a private security contractor. Around 2:00 AM, Zantonini reportedly contacted colleagues to state he was feeling ill. Emergency services arrived shortly after, but despite immediate resuscitation efforts, he was pronounced dead at the scene. While Zantonini had access to a small heated surveillance cabin, his duties required him to conduct outdoor reconnaissance rounds every two hours in the biting cold. rejected.description: If you're looking to ski for cheap this winter in Tahoe, an Incline Village ski resort is offering $60 tickets on select dates.
rejected.content: Incline Village, Nevada — If you’re looking for some cheap lift tickets in Tahoe this winter, Diamond Peak is one of your best options. In honor of the ski resort’s 60th anniversary, Diamond Peak has announced $60 deal days. This means that lift tickets will only be $60 on the following dates this season: January 14, January 29, February 9, March 17, March 27, and April 19. Also, there are $60 deals available for rentals and another $60 deal for first-time ski and boarder lessons. Click here to check out the deals. About Diamond Peak Situated on the North Shore of Tahoe, Diamond Peak first opened in 1966. rejected.content: Skiers planning a winter holiday in Switzerland may face less-transparent pricing models for lift tickets this season, according to recent reporting by Swissinfo . Consumer protection advocates are criticising the way many Swiss ski resorts sell tickets, saying that “dynamic pricing” systems can lead to hidden price increases without clear information for customers. Under these dynamic pricing schemes, ticket prices can vary depending on demand — meaning that on busier days or when lots of people are expected on the slopes, prices can rise sharply without clear caps or limits disclosed in advance. Critics argue that this system lacks transparency and can make it difficult for holidaymakers to know the true cost of a ski day before they book. rejected.content: Huge news for southern skiers and snowboarders, as Alabama’s one and only ski area is open tonight, January 27th, from 6pm-10pm. Cloudmont Ski Resort offers skiing and snowboarding accessed by a single rope tow. It’s extremely condition dependent, often opening for only a handful of days every winter. This winter’s first day for Cloudmont was back on January 18th, and they were open for 5 days between then and January 22nd. The storm led the mountain to close, but it appears the conditions and snowmaking have allowed the area to reopen this evening. Night skiing costs $50 for adults and $45 for students. When open in the day, tickets cost $70 for adults and $60 for students. Those interested in visiting Cloudmont should follow the resort’s Facebook page , as that’s where most condition updates, including whether or not they’ll be open on any given day, are posted. Alex Hackel is a top-notch skier in his own right, earning both a bronze and silver medal at the X Games in Real Ski. He is not a ski mountaineer, but he decided to race Noah Dines in a skimo race anyways. He gave himself a little boost for the contest, though, wearing the Hypershell X Series exoskeleton to see if it could give him enough of a boost to beat a world record holder. Despite throwing several challenges in Noah’s way, Alex having a mechanical boost, and Alex fully skipping a lap to make it a closer race, Noah was able to secure the win.
